articles.author: The Mercury News
articles.title: Trump offers support for dockworkers union by saying ports shouldn’t install more automated systems
articles.description: The International Longshoremen’s Association has until Jan. 15 to negotiate a new contract with the U.S. Maritime Alliance, which represents ports and shipping companies.
articles.content:
By JOSH BOAK
WASHINGTON (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump on Thursday voiced his support for the dockworkers union before their contract expires next month at Eastern and Gulf Coast ports, saying that any further “automation” of the ports would har... [4010 chars]

articles.author: The Mercury News
articles.title: Mystery drones over New Jersey could be 'shot down'
articles.description: The worry stems partly from the flying objects initially being spotted near the Picatinny Arsenal, a U.S. military research and manufacturing facility, and over President-elect Donald Trump's golf course in Bedminster.
articles.content:
By Bruce Shipkowski | Associated Press
TOMS RIVER, N.J. — A U.S. senator has called for mysterious drones spotted flying at night over sensitive areas in New Jersey and other parts of the Mid-Atlantic region to be “shot down, if necessary,” even as i... [5622 chars]

articles.author: The Inquisitr
articles.title: Joe Biden Admits He Felt 'Stupid' for Not Doing One Thing Donald Trump Did: "I Also Learned..."
articles.description: Biden also expressed concerns about Project 2025, a policy framework linked to some of Trump’s allies, calling it a potential economic disaster.
articles.content: President Joe Biden candidly admitted on Tuesday that he regretted not putting his name on pandemic relief checks during his tenure. Speaking at the Brookings Institution in Washington, Biden reflected on his decision during the rollout of the Americ... [3929 chars]

articles.author: New York Post
articles.title: Fox News host floored by revelation that Secret Service opened fire on Trump’s would-be assassin from five feet away — and missed every shot
articles.description: A Secret Service agent was five feet away from wannabe-assassin Ryan Wesley Routh and fired off six shots -- all of which failed to hit President-elect Donald Trump's would-be killer, Fox News host Jesse Watters noted in disbelief Wednesday.
articles.content:

articles.author: CNBC
articles.title: SEC charges Cantor Fitzgerald, led by Trump’s Commerce pick
articles.description: Cantor Fitzgerald CEO Howard Lutnick is co-chair of the transition team for Donald Trump. The SEC says his firm caused two SPACs to make false statements.
articles.content:
Howard Lutnick, chairman and CEO of BGC Partners Inc., speaks during the Piper Sandler Global Exchange and FinTech Conference in New York City, U.S., June 8, 2022.

articles.author: Cable News Network
articles.title: Amazon plans to donate $1 million to President-elect Donald Trump’s inauguration
articles.description: Amazon is planning to donate $1 million to President-elect Donald Trump’s inauguration, a person familiar with the matter told CNN. Amazon founder Jeff Bezos is expected to visit with Trump in person in the coming days, as he and other tech founders seek closer relationships with the incoming president.
articles.content:

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Ontario Prepares for US Trade Tensions with Potential Liquor, Electricity Restrictions
articles.description: Ontario is contemplating restricting American alcohol imports and electricity exports to US states in response to potential tariffs by President-elect Trump. The move aims to protect Canadian interests amidst tensions over immigration and trade. Alberta, however, opts for diplomacy regarding oil exports.
articles.content: Ontario is considering a drastic move to curb American alcohol imports and electricity exports to certain US states if President-elect Donald Trump carries out his tariff threats. The province, led by Premier Doug Ford, aims to protect Canadian econo... [672 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump Endorses Dockworkers' Stance Against Automation
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump expressed support for union dockworkers opposing automation on the U.S. East and Gulf Coasts. Labor talks between the ILA and USMX stalled over the issue, with a deadline looming. Trump prefers investment in workers over automation, and a recent significant wage hike was secured.
articles.content: President-elect Donald Trump has thrown his support behind union dockworkers opposing automation at U.S. ports on the East and Gulf Coasts. These labor discussions, involving the International Longshoremen's Association (ILA) and the United States Ma... [713 chars]
